intro: Eugenia hankeana, commonly known as the Hanke's eugenia, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and glossy, elliptical leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
